item.title: 中国谴责德国海军穿越台湾海峡
item.description:
北京——中国军方周六谴责两艘德国海军舰艇穿越台湾海峡，称此举增加了安全风险并发出了“错误”信号，并补充说中国军队监视并警告了这两艘舰艇。
中国声称民主统治的台湾是自己的领土，并表示只有中国才能对台湾海峡行使主权和管辖权。美国和台湾都表示，台湾海峡是一条国际水道，是一条主要贸易路线，全球约一半的集装箱船都经过这条路线。
中国人民解放军东部战区表示，两艘舰艇（一艘护卫舰和一艘补给舰）的通过是“公开炒作”，其海军和空军全程监视并警告它们。
“德方的行为增加了安全风险并发出了错误信号。战区部队始终处于高度戒备状态，将坚决反击一切威胁和挑衅，”它在一份声明中说。
中国驻德国大使馆在另一份声明中表示，已向柏林提出“交涉”，称台湾属于中国，但台北的民选政府强烈反对这一立场。
“台湾问题不是‘航行自由’问题，而是中国主权和领土完整问题，”大使馆表示。
大使馆补充说，台湾海峡是中国水域，“根本没有所谓的‘国际水域’”。
中国敦促德国避免任何可能危及双边关系健康稳定发展的“干涉”。
台湾政府表示，只有台湾人民才能决定自己的未来。
美国军舰大约每两个月穿越海峡一次，引起北京的愤怒，加拿大和英国等一些美国盟友也偶尔过境。
中国从未放弃使用武力控制台湾，过去五年来加强了台湾周边的军事活动，包括举行军事演习。

item.title: “开创性”的现实主义是《幕府将军》成功的关键
item.description:
东京——《幕府将军》中的武士走路时不会摆动手臂——这只是众多真实的历史细节之一，这些细节帮助这部热门电视剧成为今年艾美奖的头号竞争者。
这部时代剧因其对准确性的严谨态度而受到称赞，创造了电视史上的 25 项艾美奖提名，并在周日的颁奖典礼前已横扫 14 个小奖项。
《幕府将军》以 17 世纪早期的封建日本为背景，打破了西方电影和电视几十年来对日本的陈词滥调和经常拙劣的描述。
包括几位来自日本的假发技师在内的一大批专家在幕后工作，仔细研究布景、服装和演员的动作，使该剧变得逼真。
京都历史学家 Frederik Cryns 为从和服类型到榻榻米位置等所有方面提供了建议。
“我的评论被汇编起来，令我惊讶的是，它变成了一本 2100 页的手册”，几乎一字不差地被遵循，克莱恩斯是日本国际研究中心的教授，他告诉法新社。
克莱恩斯说，他在观看以日本为主题的好莱坞电影时，经常会因为不准确而感到“不舒服”。
但克莱恩斯表示，《幕府将军》是同类作品中最真实的一部。这部作品由迪士尼旗下的 FX 制作，由日本演员真田广之联合制作，他也是该系列的主演。
“说实话，第一次看完这部剧后，我眼里噙满了泪水”，他说。
“独立”女性
《幕府将军》在日语中意为“将军”，改编自詹姆斯·克拉维尔的一部流行小说，在加拿大拍摄。
一些角色受到真正的历史人物的启发，包括主角托拉纳加（Sanada），他是根据日本著名的军阀托瓦瓦·伊亚修（Tokugawa Ieyasu）的启发。 A-在日本勇士家庭中使用的一根弯曲的杆子。 He was also in Vancouver during filming to advise on "shosa" -- stylized movements from kabuki, a traditional Japanese form of theatre.
"There are correct ways to walk, sit and stand in a kimono, but it's difficult for young actors" who don't have regular experience wearing such outfits, Hannojo said.
"For example, samurai don't swing their arms when walking. They glide without moving the upper body."
Some of the cast struggled with more graceful motions, such as when noblewomen would stand up straight from the floor without crouching, he said.
"It looks beautiful" and "Japanese people used to have muscles for that -- but not anymore, because we sit on chairs!" he quipped.
'120%'
Japanese is spoken in 70% of Shogun -- a choice producer Eriko Miyagawa described as "groundbreaking."
尽管大多数人可能没有注意到，但剧组努力让道具都真实，因为他们“想做到 120%”，她说。
例如，卷轴上的文字是由温哥华的日本书法家用历史人物的笔迹书写的，这些人物就是以这些人物为原型的。
宫川说，对真实性的承诺“来自 FX 高层”。
“他们选择了贾斯汀·马克斯（作为节目主持人）……他对日本文化有着无尽的好奇心和尊重，”她说。
“他们从一开始就让真田广之和我担任制片人，”她补充道。“这是一件大事。”
FX 目前正在开发更多季的《幕府将军》——但第一部中并非所有内容都是真实的。
与其他武士不同，虎长的头发没有从中间剃掉——这是出于视觉原因而做出的创意决定。
Miyagawa, who began her career as a translator for Kill Bill in 2003 and worked as a co-producer for Martin Scorsese's Silence, said the team "probably couldn't have pulled off" the series 10 years ago.
A previous TV miniseries adaptation of the novel made in 1980 was centered on Blackthorne's perspective. And yes, the samurai did swing their arms.
"The world has changed and the market has evolved," which "paved the way" for the show's success, said Miyagawa.
"I like to think Shogun pushed this evolution forward."

莫斯科——当俄罗斯人因反对乌克兰攻势而开始被捕时，玛丽亚感受到了与她猜测的祖先——苏联领导人约瑟夫·斯大林统治下的镇压受害者——一样的恐惧。
俄罗斯发动军事攻势已经两年半了，数百人因抗议或公开反对该运动而入狱——即使是私下里——这场镇压让克里姆林宫的国内批评者陷入瘫痪。
“当你开始像你的祖先那样行事时，这不正常。每次电话铃响时都会抽搐……一直想着你在和谁说话，你在说什么，”47 岁的莫斯科人玛丽亚告诉法新社。
“我的恐惧越来越强烈。”
玛丽亚翻阅一本有斯大林清洗受害者照片的书，指着她的曾祖父。
他是波兰人，被宣布为“人民公敌”，并于 1938 年因“间谍罪”被处决。
斯大林于1953年去世后，他的妻子在苏维埃（Gulag）的苏维埃（Gulag）上度过了四年，他的妻子在玛丽亚（Maria）的祖母（玛丽亚（Maria）的祖母中，他都必须与父母的污名化，他在玛丽亚（Maria of Mareia）的情况下，她也很担心，他也会感到恐惧。在弗拉基米尔·普京（Vladimir Putin）的政权上，用来批评普京的自我审查的批评者也可以将其针对反对者的批评者。 In such a climate, Maria, an English professor at a university, is cautious about how she behaves and what she says in public.
Outside her circle of close friends, she hides her pacifist convictions and her fondness for Ukrainian culture.
She doesn't discuss politics with her colleagues, and lives in fear that somebody could denounce her for reading Western news or social media sites blocked in Russia that she accesses through a VPN.
English itself is now considered an "enemy language" that raises suspicions, said Maria, who asked for her surname to be withheld.
When she is reading news articles on her phone on public transport, she said she "immediately closes" the page and starts playing a game "if I realize there is a person next to me not reading anything but just looking around."
Fearing her phone will be searched at passport control, she cleanses it before traveling of any chats where the fighting in Ukraine might have been mentioned.
She is also afraid to wear her vyshyvanka, a traditional stitched Ukrainian shirt, in public, and shuns combining yellow and blue clothes -- the colors of the Ukrainian flag.
'Do not dare'
After a brief eruption of anticonflict rallies in February 2022, the Kremlin has since stymied almost all shows of public opposition.
"People do not dare to protest, do not dare to speak out," said Svetlana Gannushkina, a prominent Russian rights activist who has been labelled a "foreign agent."
Heavy sentences for regime critics along with harsh treatment of prisoners has scared many into silence, she said.
Gannushkina pointed to what she called a "historical, maybe even genetic, fear" in a country that has seen multiple bouts of political repression -- from serfdom in the Russian Empire, the Bolsheviks' "Red Terror" after the 1917 Revolution and the 1930s purges under Stalin.
Her Memorial group worked to preserve the memory of victims of Communist repression and campaigned against modern rights violations until Russian authorities shut it down in 2021.
Through history, repression has repeatedly "divided society into those who were ready to submit and those who did not want to, understood that resistance leads to nothing, and left," Gannushkina told AFP.
"History has made a kind of natural selection. ... And now we've got a whole generation of people who are not ready to resist."
'Slave to fear'
For Soviet dissident Alexander Podrabinek, 71, fear "is not an ethnic, national or genetic peculiarity" specific to Russia.
"I have visited several totalitarian countries besides the Soviet Union and the situation is basically the same everywhere," he told AFP.
"Fear is the main obstacle to a normal life in our country. ... Fear demoralizes people, deprives them of their freedom."
"Someone who is afraid is no longer free. They become a slave to their fear, living without being able to realize their potential," he added.
Podrabinek was exiled to Russia's Siberia in 1978 and then imprisoned in 1981 after writing a book on punitive psychiatry in the USSR.
Despite pressure from the KGB security services, he refused to leave the country.
"The only thing that can overcome fear," he said, "is the conviction that you are right."

南苏丹朱巴——南苏丹政府将原定于 12 月举行的选举推迟了两年，理由是需要完成人口普查、起草永久宪法和政党登记等程序。
总统国家安全顾问图特·加特卢阿克周五表示，此次延期将为在 2026 年 12 月 22 日的新选举日期之前完成关键程序提供机会。
这是该国第二次推迟选举并延长从 2020 年 2 月开始的过渡期，该国于 2011 年获得独立。
总统萨尔瓦·基尔和他以前的竞争对手、现任副总统里克·马沙尔于 2018 年签署了一项和平协议，结束了一场持续五年、造成 40 多万人死亡的内战。
内阁事务部长马丁·埃利亚·洛穆罗表示，此次延期遵循了选举机构和安全部门的建议。
上个月，国家选举委员会主席阿贝德尼戈·阿科克教授告诉美联社，该国的选举日程落后，选举日程要求选民登记从 6 月开始，但由于资金短缺，这一进程仍未完成。
该国正在经历一场经济危机，公务员近一年没有领到工资，原因是该国石油出口受到邻国苏丹一条受损管道的影响，苏丹的石油出口是通过这条管道出口的，苏丹饱受战争蹂躏。
在邻国肯尼亚进行的图马尼倡议和平谈判也陷入停滞，据信该谈判为非签署方团体的参与提供了基础，以维持和平。
一项允许无证拘留的新安全法案于 8 月通过，尽管人权组织担心这会在选举前引起恐慌。
独立政治分析家安德里亚·马赫·马比奥警告说，任何虚假选举都可能导致资源浪费和混乱。
“举行不符合国际标准的选举将浪费金钱，”马比奥告诉美联社。
但社区赋权进步组织执行主任埃德蒙·亚卡尼等人表示，推迟选举或延长过渡期可能会导致这个脆弱的国家爆发暴力事件。
“如果我们未能在 2024 年 12 月举行选举，那么该国陷入暴力的可能性将高于举行选举的可能性，”亚卡尼 8 月告诉美联社。
根据 2024 年联合国南苏丹人道主义需求概览，这个经历了内战和气候变化冲击的国家需要人道主义援助，预计 2024 年将有 900 万人（占该国人口的 73%）需要人道主义援助。
